docs.snippet: Advisers and allies say Mrs. Clinton would try to find common ground with Republicans on immigration and infrastructure spending, and appoint women to half of her cabinet posts....
docs.lead_paragraph: Advisers and allies say Mrs. Clinton would try to find common ground with Republicans on immigration and infrastructure spending, and appoint women to half of her cabinet posts.
docs.abstract: Hillary Clinton's plans for her first 100 days in office, should she be elected president, include quickly finding ground with Republican lawmakers, placing women in key positions of power and bringing back intimate negotiation style; it remains to be seen whether Republicans would be willing to negotiate, while some liberals have called for more aggressive pushback against Republican agenda.

headline.main: ‘President Hillary Clinton?’ She Wants Progress on Immigration and to Drink With G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: A Second President Clinton?  Mapping Out Her First 100 Days

headline.main: Box Office: 'Finding Dory' Dominates 'Tarzan,' Spielberg's 'The BFG' Bombs
headline.print_headline: Box Office: 'Finding Dory' Dominates 'Tarzan,' Spielberg's 'The BFG' Bombs

docs.snippet: Climate change is threatening the livelihoods of the people of tiny Kiribati, and even the island nation’s existence. The government is making plans for the island’s demise....
docs.lead_paragraph: Climate change is threatening the livelihoods of the people of tiny Kiribati, and even the island nation’s existence. The government is making plans for the island’s demise.
docs.abstract: Tidal surge which swept through Kiribati in 2015 is heightening alarms from scientists that climate change will soon make low-lying island nation uninhabitable; former Pres Anote Tong, whose administration created potential refuge in Fiji and has been encouraging job-skilled residents to emigrate, says his country's plight is worldwide climate wake-up call and its impact is very real.

headline.main: A Remote Pacific Nation, Threatened by Rising Seas
headline.print_headline: Remote Pacific Nation, Threatened by Rising Seas
